subsection.name: 5.1 Introduction
subsection.p: The following steps are needed to write and deploy a Cayenne application. Each one of the steps is discussed in detail in the following subsections.

- Create Cayenne Project : Cayenne project is a set of configuration files needed for a Java application to work with Cayenne. All these files are in XML format. They can either be edited by hand or using CayenneModeler GUI tool.
- Generate Java classes : In Cayenne ObjEntities map to Java classes that implement DataObject interface. CayenneModeler can be used to generate and maintain such Java classes.
- Access Cayenne classes from your Java code : Access to Cayenne functionality at the user (Java developer) level is done via DataContext class.

- Configure deployment environment : Depending on how you plan to deploy your application you may configure Cayenne in a few ways. Possible deployment scenarious include standalone application, web application, EJB application.
